resources.string: A short introduction and general overview
The Kubriko game engine is a lightweight, scalable, and easy-to-use solution for creating simple, 2D games that target the Android, Desktop (Windows, Linux, macOS), iOS, or Web platforms.

Kubriko is based on Compose Multiplatform and is written entirely in Kotlin. As a result it can seamlessly be integrated into any Compose project.\n\nFor more information check out the GitHub repository, where you can find the source code of the library, as well as this application. If you run into any issues / bugs, have feature request ideas, or would like to contribute in any way, that is the starting point.
The project repository also hosts a number of helpful learning materials. To start using the engine for your own games, follow the guide for creating a new project, or read the documentation.

Watching the step by step tutorial videos is another great way to understand how the games in this Showcase are implemented. You can also join our Discord server to discuss more advanced topics with the community, or to promote your own creations.
Kubriko is under active development and will evolve together with the games that are being created with it. The library is open source and free to use under MPL 2.0.
